You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Set Up a Storefront

A storefront is the user-facing website where your buyers can browse products, place orders, and manage their accounts. An org needs at least one storefront, and each storefront needs an associated Experience Cloud site. The managed package doesn’t create a storefront for you, so follow these steps to set up a storefront and its site.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
NOTE Before you set up a storefront, make sure that you correctly prepare your org and install the managed package.
Create Storefront Information in CC Admin
When you’re ready to create a storefront, first add information about your storefront to CC Admin. Load your product records and other storefront data, apply a storefront theme, and refresh the B2B Commerce for Visualforce data cache to include the contents of new storefront.
Create an Experience Cloud Site for the Storefront
Create an Experience Cloud site in your org to serve the pages of your B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefront.
Configure Public Pages for a Storefront
An Experience Cloud site lets you specify default pages for different site functions, such as the home page, password management, and server response error pages. For these functions, assign the Visualforce pages that the B2B Commerce managed package installs.
Configure the Storefront Secure Domain
When you create an Experience Cloud site, a domain name is automatically assigned. B2B Commerce for Visualforce references this domain name when linking users from the Site Login page to the Site Register page. Add the domain name to the storefront settings in CC Admin.
Assign Permissions for Storefront Guest Users
An Experience Cloud site automatically creates a profile that's applied to a user who visits the site but hasn't logged in to an account. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides a default permission set that provides a starting point for restricting guest user access to your org's data. To help keep your storefront secure against unauthorized access, verify some settings on the guest user profile and apply the appropriate permissions.
Assign Permissions for Storefront Registered Users
Recall that, before you installed the managed package, you created a custom user profile for your storefront's registered users. The profile provides access to the Apex classes, Visualforce pages, and other resources that provide a successful storefront experience for buyers. Associate that profile with your Experience Cloud site's members so that when a user registers on the storefront, they become a site member and inherit the profile.
Assign Visualforce Pages for User Self-Registration
To allow a guest user to create an account on your storefront, configure the Experience Cloud site with the appropriate B2B Commerce Visualforce pages.
Create a Default Owner for Records Created by a Storefront Guest User
The security alert Assign Records Created by Guest Users to a Default Owner adds a Digital Experiences setting, Assign new records created by guest users to the default owner. When enabled, this setting restricts a guest user from owning any sObject records, including B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects such as CC Carts. To comply with the requirement, create a user record that serves as the default owner of all records a guest user creates. Then, update your storefront configuration settings with the user's ID.
Configure External Sharing Settings for Storefront Users
To make sure that your buyers can successfully access your storefront's content, set up the appropriate sharing settings. These settings grant the minimum access necessary for certain B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects, which power your storefront's content and experience. These settings also ensure that access for a guest user is as restrictive as possible by default, which helps secure your storefront against unauthorized access.
Create Sharing Rules for Guest User Access to Storefront Objects
A guest user isn't just a real human that's browsing your storefront but hasn't registered for an account. The managed package includes code that executes in the context of a guest user, such as an Apex class that rewrites URLs to make them human-readable. You previously restricted guest user access to records by default, which was a required security measure. To ensure that a B2B Commerce for Visualforce guest user (human or otherwise) can still access your storefront, create sharing rules for only the necessary objects.
Add Account Group to the Standard Account Layout
B2B Commerce for Visualforce installs a CC Account Group custom object to manage entitlements and pricing for products that storefront users see. To help admins quickly view which account group an account belongs to, add the Account Group field to the standard account layout.
Finalize and Publish Your Storefront
With your Experience Cloud site, users, permissions, and storefront data in place, you’re nearly finished with storefront setup. To wrap up, activate your site, enable protection from malicious behavior, and test user self-registration.

No
title: Setting Up a Salesforce B2B Commerce Storefront
